item.description:
@Piled_by_Noobs wrote:

Fatal Desire:

Umm…Are you sure the ints are right? I always just make my own incase the person made a mistake XD.

I did them myself, they are right, they have no errors until I used my model, which is just a sort-of replica of the drop/inv model of normal godswords.[quote=“pkkid, post:5, topic:324405”]When you made your model.
You have to do 10 at that model viewer.[/quote]
Did that… :/[quote=“Fatal Desire, post:7, topic:324405”]Try a lower number Piled.[/quote]
I did that also… Lol, I tried a lot of things, nothings working.

item.title: Class8 problem
item.dc:creator: @Piled_by_Noobs Piled by Noobs
item.description:
@Piled_by_Noobs wrote:

I was changing the ints to a Zaros godsword to make it look like a real Godsword inventory model. Now whenever I spawn one/log on with one in my inventory, my client freezes and gets an error… Sorry if this is in the wrong section, I figured it was client help because I’m pretty sure it’s a problem with Class8.java.

Here’s my ints:

if(i == 13896) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[0]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[0]; class8.anInt174 = 13215; class8.anInt181 = 1956; class8.anInt190 = 2124; class8.anInt198 = 72; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 13214; class8.anInt200 = 13214; class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Zaros godsword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "An evil, heavy sword.".getBytes(); }

And here’s my error:

Exception in thread "Thread-6" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2124 at Class8.method200(Class8.java:4055) at client.method105(client.java:9768) at client.method36(client.java:2221) at client.method102(client.java:9211) at client.method9(client.java:10377) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:136) at client.run(client.java:5287) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

I don’t think this matters, but I was using Frell’s RIG things to get the proper ints.

Read full topic
